result.execSummary:
The defendant Roger D Willis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
EACH COUNT: Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: with 249 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence & Count 3.

superMiscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Concurrent with: with 249 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence & Count 2.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roger D Willis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roger D Willis in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Roger D Willis in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS 6 MONTHS with 249 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence & Count 3; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 249 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence & Count 2. 

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Witness fee request prepared for Brian C. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
D284
cf
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Roger D Willis in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Roger D Willis in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  At the hour of 1:44pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY as to Counts 2 (theft from person) & 3 (possession of a controlled substance THC), which were then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Stipulation and Order for Return/Destruction of Exhibits received and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roger D Willis in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Roger D Willis in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIED the defense motion for jury instruction 317.  At the hour of 9:37am jury back in box.  Court completed instructing the jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 11:02am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Scasny and Hinkley who were duly sworn for that purpose. Jury out of box.  Sidebars placed on the record.  Jury trial scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Body attachment for Joshua H canceled.

At the hour of 1:55pm jury back in box.

Sworn for the state:  WI State Crime Lab Analyst Birjees Kauser. 

Exhibits 9 & 20 received.  

Jury out box.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court. 

Sworn for defense out of the presence of the jury: Seth O with Attorney Richard Smith.  Witness pleads the 5th, Court releases witness.  Defense no longer wishes to call Joshua H as a witness, however he is present in court with Attorney Jeff Schwarz.  The court orders the body attachement/warrant cleared.

Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived right to testify.

Jury in the box. Exhibits 2, 10 & 12-17 received.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  

At the hour of 4:09pm jury dismissed for the day, but ordered to return at 8:55am on 01/21/2016.
Witness Joshua H not present.  Court ordered body attachment.

Defendant Roger D Willis in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Roger D Willis in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated on the record, the Court appointed Attorney Richard Smith to represent witness Seth O for the purpose of this jury trial.  Attorney Smith to be paid at the rate of $60/hour.  Witness is not required to reimburse Milwaukee County.  Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed.

Defendant Roger D Willis in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Roger D Willis in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 At the hour of 8:52am jury back in box.

Testimony continued from previously sworn State witness Village of Greendale Officer Anthony Fitzgerald.

Sworn for the state:  Village of Greendale Officer Jeff Dibb, former Village of Greendale Detective Robert Windler.

Exhibits 5-8 received and published to the jury.

Exhibits 13-17 published to the jury.

Jury out of box.  Sidebars placed on the record.  Testimony continued from former Village of Greendale Police Detective Robert Windler.

Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Detective James Henner and Village of Greendale Police Lieutenant Bridgette Paul.

At the hour of 11:52am jury dismissed for the lunch, but ordered to return at 1:15pm on 1/20/2016.  Sidebars placed on the record.  Jury trial scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Roger D Willis in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Roger D Willis in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  At the hour of 1:57pm jury back in box.  Voir dire continued.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.   Court instructed jury.  Jury out of box.  Strikes for cause placed on the record.  Jury in box.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Citizens Brian C, Jessica H, Charles S and Village of Greendale Police Officer Anthony Fitzgerald.  Exhibits 1, 3 and 4 received and published to the jury.  Exhibit 2 published to the jury.  At the hour of 4:49pm jury dismissed for the day, but ordered to return at 8:40am on 01/20/2016.  Sidebars placed on the record.  Jury trial scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Roger D Willis in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Roger D Willis in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered witnesses sequestered with the exception of a court officer.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 11:32am.  At the hour of 12:01pm jury dismissed for the lunch, but ordered to return at 1:25pm on 01/19/2016.  Jury trial scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Roger D Willis in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Roger D Willis in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for motion hearing.  
Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIED the defense motion for reconsideration. 
Court ordered witnesses sequestered. Court allows student intern Carlos Pedraza to remain in the courtroom.  Sworn for the state: Former Greendale Police Detective Robert Windler.  Exhibit 1 received and withdrawn.  Exhibit list received and filed.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIED the defense Miranda Goodchild motion.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.
Defendant's Motion for Reconsideration of Motion for Dismissal for Selective and Discriminatory Prosecution received and filed.
